title: TB starts on wrong monitor
content:
I use 128.7.1esr (64-bit) on Windows 11 23H2. OS Name Microsoft Windows 11 Home Version 10.0.22631 Build 22631 I use two monitors: Monitor 1 is physically straight in front of me, and Monitor 2 is to the left, so in Settings > System > Display the box on the right is numbered 1, and the box on the left is numbered 2.

Since the latest TB update, each time I switch on the PC in the morning, TB (and FF) open on Monitor 2, even though I closed them down on Monitor 1 the previous night. This behaviour used to happen occasionally, now it seems to happen every time. Also, occasionally during the day, the TB Reminders window will jump to Monitor 2 while it's minimised.

I suppose the first question is - is this a TB/FF problem or a Windows problem? I'm thinking it must be a TB/FF problem, because this behaviour only seems to be happening with them.

Any suggestions would be welcome.
creator: bxcfilm

title: Tb 128 - cannot see how to send email via Mailing List (allowing selection) as previously possible.
content:
I want to send an email to most (but not all) the members of a mailing list - as I used to be able to. In the historic (2015) Help article "How to create and use mailing lists on Thunderbird" the first of 2 methods of "Create email using a mailing list" was "Via the Address Book"; "each contact in the mailing list will appear in a separate To field. This allows you to remove a name, if desired. " To do this, the 3 steps were:- 1 Click Address Book to open it. 2 Select the mailing list. 3 Click the Write button. Using 128.7.1esr (64-bit), step 3 is not available; the 4 options after selecting the mailing list are

  • Edit list
  • Export
  • Print
  • Delete

Is there a way of actually doing what used to be possible before the improvements took place (and IIIBDFI was forgotten?)
creator: EmmBee

title: Thunderbird in Windows 11
content:
Hi all.

I have just installed Thunderbird on my laptop, due to ongoing issues with using Outlook.

I have an MS Access database that I built using macros (I know, but it works perfectly fine for what I need!) I send emails with a signature and PDF attachments, or sometimes through a gateway (email to SMS), to inform guest about booking details at my small hotel.

Previously with Outlook, when I hit send on the database, it would pop the Outlook email window for me to review the mail before confirming send. Now I fin in Thunderbird, it doesn't display over the other apps, so I'm having to minimise or close the DB window, to review and send the mail.

I have already set Thunderbird as the default app in the setting menu, for all mail tasks and file types, and can't seem to find any other setting to allow it to display on top.

I was therefore wondering if anyone else has encountered a similar issue, and if they have, whether they were able to solve it before pulling out too much of their hair!

Any help would be much appreciated, thank you.

Mick Courcier
creator: mico705

title: How do I disable sent folder
content: I'm running Thunderbird 128.7.1esr (64-bit) on Windows 11. I'm trying to set it up such that emails aren't automatically saved in the Sent folder unless I ask. In settings->Copies & Folders, I have "Place a copy in" disabled. This doesn't work; i.e. all emails are still saved in the Sent folder. Is there something else I need to do so emails are only saved when I ask it to. If this matters, I have Thunderbird set up for my Gmail account using iMap. Is there something I need to disable directly in my Google/Gmail settings?
creator: kenakahn

title: Problem with Switch to folder in Menu Bar
content:
I added "Switch to folder" to the Menu Bar. Intermittently this does not work. I am using this icon to switch to a local folder.

I just discovered something.

I have multiple email addresses. I discovered that if I select the icon and the "inbox" folder of a different email address Thunderbird switches to that folder. If I then select a local folder it switches to that folder. I tried several local folders and it continues to select the correct folder.

I will be looking an email and want to save it in a local folder. I may have to create a new sub-folder. I use the "Switch to folder" icon to select the parent folder so I can create a sub-folder. Most of the time this does not work and then sometimes it does work.

Am I doing something wrong or is there a problem with Thunderbird?

title: certificati autofirmati
content: Buongiorno, da qualche settimana si stanno riscontrando problemi per quanto riguarda il certificato autofirmato del server di posta.
